panels.description: Cell-wide compaction progress. Should increase till completion throughout each compaction period.
panels.title: Overall progress

panels.description: Cell-wide compaction progress. Should increase till completion throughout each compaction period.

targets.expr:
sum by (tenant) (loki_bloomplanner_tenant_tasks_completed{cluster=~"$cluster", job=~"$namespace/bloom-planner"})
/
sum by (tenant) (loki_bloomplanner_tenant_tasks_planned{cluster=~"$cluster", job=~"$namespace/bloom-planner"})

panels.title: Progress by tenant

panels.description: Blooms size vs uncompressed chunk size.
panels.title: Errors Planner

panels.description: Blooms size vs uncompressed chunk size.
panels.title: Errors Builder

targets.expr:
# series checked per compaction
histogram_quantile(
    0.99, 
    sum by (le) (
        rate(loki_bloombuilder_series_per_task_bucket{cluster="$cluster", job="$namespace/bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
)

# series checked per compaction
histogram_quantile(
    0.9, 
    sum by (le) (
        rate(loki_bloombuilder_series_per_task_bucket{cluster="$cluster", job="$namespace/bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
)

# series checked per compaction
histogram_quantile(
    0.75, 
    sum by (le) (
        rate(loki_bloombuilder_series_per_task_bucket{cluster="$cluster", job="$namespace/bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
)

# series checked per compaction
histogram_quantile(
    0.5, 
    sum by (le) (
        rate(loki_bloombuilder_series_per_task_bucket{cluster="$cluster", job="$namespace/bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
)

panels.title: Series per task (includes series copied from other blocks)

targets.expr:
# series checked per compaction
histogram_quantile(
    0.99, 
    sum by (le) (
        rate(loki_bloombuilder_bytes_per_task_bucket{cluster="$cluster", job="$namespace/bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
)

# series checked per compaction
histogram_quantile(
    0.9, 
    sum by (le) (
        rate(loki_bloombuilder_bytes_per_task_bucket{cluster="$cluster", job="$namespace/bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
)

# series checked per compaction
histogram_quantile(
    0.5, 
    sum by (le) (
        rate(loki_bloombuilder_bytes_per_task_bucket{cluster="$cluster", job="$namespace/bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
)

panels.title: Number of bytes from chunks added to blocks during each compaction.

options.content: Identify the tenant using the **_Progress by tenant_** panel from the overview and set tenant variable

panels.description: How many tokens each builder is appending to blooms. Accounts for tokens that are not actually added to the blooms since they are already there. See the panel on the right for a drill down on the collision.
panels.title: Tokens rate

panels.description:
Collision type may be `false` (no collision), `cache` (found in token cache) or true (found in bloom filter).

Type may be either `raw` (the original ngram) or `chunk_prefixed` (the ngram with the chunk prefix)

targets.expr:
# tokens/s by type+collision
sum by (collision) (
    rate(loki_bloom_inserts_total{cluster="$cluster", job="$namespace/bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval])
) 
/ on () group_left
sum (
    rate(loki_bloom_inserts_total{cluster="$cluster", job="$namespace/bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval])
)

panels.title: tokens/s by collision type

panels.description: The sizes of the blooms created by the compactor. We build one bloom per series. The more unique ngrams and chunks the series has, the bigger their blooms will be.
panels.title: Bloom size

panels.description:
How many chunks are we indexing in the blooms. Either:
- `copied` from a pre-existing bloom block, or 
- `iterated` through all its entries if processed for the first time.

targets.expr:
# chunks indexed, by iteration or copied from a pre-existing bloom
sum(rate(loki_bloom_chunks_indexed_total{cluster="$cluster", job="$namespace/bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval])) by (type)

panels.title: Chunks indexed

panels.description:
Shows the expected number of cpu cores we need to provision to build blooms as fast as we ingest data so a build iteration doesn't take longer than the build interval.

We may decide to have more to speed up building blooms.

targets.expr:
# This query shows the expected number of cpu cores we need to not fall behind
# building blooms for data we're ingesting.
# conceptually, the formula is:
# (cell_bytes * space_amplification / bloom_bytes_processed_per_core)

# number of replicas needed
sum(avg_over_time(loki_cell:bytes:rate1m{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace"}[$__rate_interval]))
*
## Space amplification (how much data do we write compared to what we ingest?)
(
  # rep factor
  3 *
  sum(
    # 1 - dedupe_ratio
    1 - 
    sum(rate(loki_chunk_store_deduped_chunks_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace"}[$__rate_interval])) by (cluster, namespace)
    /
    sum(rate(loki_ingester_chunks_flushed_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace"}[$__rate_interval])) by (cluster, namespace)
  )
)
/
(
sum(rate(loki_bloombuilder_chunk_series_size_sum{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", container="bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval]))
/
sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", container="bloom-builder"}[$__rate_interval]))
)

min(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", container=~"bloom-builder", resource="cpu"} > 0)
*
count(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", container=~"bloom-builder", resource="cpu"} > 0)

panels.title: Required CPUs to not lag behind

panels.description: Compactors delete metas and blocks marked for deletion in the metas tombstones.
panels.title: Deleted Metas

panels.description: Compactors delete metas and blocks marked for deletion in the metas tombstones.
panels.title: Deleted Blocks

panels.description: Number of overlapping bloom blocks reused when creating new blocks
panels.title: Blocks reused

panels.description: How much time applying retention took
panels.title: Retention time

options.content:
During the planning phase, the planner downloads the metas and TSDBs to build the plan.

Once all blocks and metas are built, the builder flushes them to the object store.

After each iteration, the planner deletes the metas and blocks marked for deletion in the tombstones.

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.50, sum by (operation, le) (rate(loki_s3_request_duration_seconds_bucket{cluster="$cluster", job="$namespace/bloom-planner", job=""} [$__rate_interval])))
